full_text: Case 1:19-cr-00490-RMB Document 20 Filed 07/16/19 Page 19 of 24 19 j782epsC kjc 1 will be child's play to find that; bonds from other people, surety bonds from other people. 2 3 Because we have not had an opportunity to see our client until today and because we have just received the government's submission, what we would like to do is have the opportunity to sit down and put together a bail package, a coherent bail package in writing and provide it to the court. 4 5 6 7 I would point out on the obstruction allegation -- 8 THE COURT: Let me ask you this -- sorry to interrupt you -- do you want to adjourn the detention hearing? Under the statute, you have up to three days. 9 10 11 MR. WEINGARTEN: What I would like is to have until the end of the week to provide something in writing, a specific recommendation in writing. 12 13 14 THE COURT: So you want to adjourn a determination of bail? 15 16 MR. WEINGARTEN: Yes. 17 18 THE COURT: Is there any objection to that from the government? The defendant is detained in the interim under 3142(f). 19 20 21 MR. WEINGARTEN: Right. 22 MR. ROSSMILLER: Your Honor, we certainly don't object if the defendant is consenting to detention with leave to make a further application. 23 24 I think the government would like at least a brief 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00000424

Under the statute, you have up to three days. 9 10 11 MR.
